Dear Ms. Calcaterra:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis
Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 10/07/23, youth was physically put in a room by staff member.
Staff pushed youth on the floor to her knees and she hit her chin
on the cement from the bedframe. Youth has a nickel size bruise
on her arm and her back hurts. Youth has been at the facility since
09/26/23. Staff were having issues with her behavior, so they were
trying to put her in a secluded room.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Administrator was interviewed face to face at
the facility on 10/10/23 alone and on 10/17/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Administrator reported he became aware
of the allegations because Youth A met with Clinician and
reported concerns. Administrator asked Clinician to have Youth A
write a statement about the incident, which she did. Administrator
called Supervisor 1 and told him he was being reassigned to a
different building until the investigation was complete. Consultant
reviewed the video footage with Administrator. Administrator was
asked about Supervisor 1 pushing Youth A and about Staff 1 and
Supervisor pulling Youth A to the room by her arms. Administrator
stated “It’s a culture here. What are staff to do when it’s a stand-
off with a youth for 90 minutes? Staff feel we have lost all control.
Youth know we can’t go hands on unless it’s life or death, so they
say, ‘fuck you’ and do whatever they want. Staff are burnt out.”
When asked about Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 grabbing Youth A's
arms and yanking her down the hallway, Administrator identified
those actions as Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 completing a physical
escort down the hallway. Administrator noted he did not feel
Supervisor or Staff 1 did anything wrong during the incident.
Administrator stated, “The State has made it really punitive with
the new restraint rules, so staff feel they cannot do anything”.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
10/17/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
on 10/7/23 she was talking to Staff 1 about what another youth did
2

to her the previous night, but it didn’t seem like he was listening.
Youth A admitted she became angry and escalated. Youth A
reported when she became escalated, Staff 1 called for
assistance and Supervisor 1 came to help. Youth A reported
Supervisor 1 must have thought she was going to hit Staff 1
because he got in between the two of them, pushed her
backwards and said, “you’re too close to staff”. Youth A reported
Supervisor 1 told her to get in a seclusion room, but she did not
want to go into a seclusion room, so she didn’t comply. Staff 1 and
Supervisor 1 each grabbed one of her wrists/lower arms, yanked
her in front of the room and shoved her into the room. Youth A
reported she tried to resist going into the room because they
grabbed her, but she didn’t fight back.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
10/17/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 1
reported Staff 1 called for assistance due to Youth A’s behaviors
(i.e., threatening Staff 1 and throwing items down the hallway), so
he responded to help. Supervisor 1 reported when he arrived,
Youth A was standing in front of the staff office and Staff 1
provided him with a summary of what occurred. Youth A then
approached Staff 1 in an aggressive physical manner, so
Supervisor 1 reported he stepped in between them and used his
left arm to swipe and create space in between them. Supervisor 1
reported he also told Youth A to step back, back-up or stop, and
“we’re not doing this”. Supervisor 1 reported he asked Youth A to
sit down in the hallway and relax, but she refused. Supervisor 1
reported he and Staff 1 helped Youth A to a seclusion room by
completing a CPI two-man transport which included each of them
putting one of their hands around Youth A’s wrists while their other
hand was on her shoulders. Supervisor 1 was asked about
pushing Youth A when he stepped in between Youth A and Staff 1
in the hallway. Supervisor 1 reported he was trying to create
space between Staff 1 and Youth A and there was no intent to
forcefully push her, but it might have been harder than he thought.
Supervisor 1 reported keeping personal space was the biggest
goal for him, which is why things quickly became more physical.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/17/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported on
10/7/23, Youth A began talking to him about a situation that
occurred the night before. Staff 1 explained to her he didn’t work
the night before, so he couldn’t speak about what happened or
why. Staff 1 reported Youth A kept getting louder, so he tried to
explain to her again, but she wasn’t calming down. Staff 1
reported Youth A threw a Pink Lotion bottle down the hallway.
3

Staff 1 reported normally he and Youth A have a decent rapport,
so he asked her to sit and refocus, so they could continue the
conversation when she was calmer. Staff 1 reported Youth A
refused to sit and called him a “fat motherfucker”. Staff 1 reported
he called for assistance and Supervisor 1 arrived. Supervisor 1
told Youth A to have a seat several times, but she didn’t listen.
Staff 1 reported while he was debriefing with Supervisor 1, Youth
A came towards him, so Supervisor 1 stepped in between them
and said, “don’t touch my staff”. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 1 put
his arm out to stop her but did not push her. Staff 1 reported he
and Supervisor 1 did a two-person CPI transport to get her into a
seclusion room.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/17/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported Youth A
was attempting to talk to Staff 1 about an incident that occurred
the night before. Staff 2 reported while they were talking, Youth A
went from 0 to 100 quickly. Staff 2 reported Youth A was yelling
and throwing grooming items down the hallway. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 called for Supervisor 1’s assistance. Staff 2 reported she
did not see or hear anything after Staff 1 called for assistance.
Clinician was interviewed face to face at the facility on
10/17/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Clinician reported
Youth A filled out a form on 10/9/23 requesting to meet with him.
Clinician reported during their meeting, she showed him a bruise
on her right top forearm which was approximately the size of a
quarter. Youth A talked to him about the incident and reported the
information in the allegations. Clinician reported Youth A stated
she felt safe going back to the unit. After the meeting with Youth
A, Clinician spoke with Supervisor 2 about the incident. Supervisor
2 sent the concerns via email to Administrator and Supervisor 1.
Administrator then filed a MDHHS complaint. Clinician spoke with
Youth A to let her know a complaint was made and asked her to
write a statement about the incident per the request of
Administrator.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via video
conference on 10/19/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker.
The video footage was reviewed with CA. CA noted concerns
Youth A was standing still in a corner when Supervisor 1 and Staff
1 aggressively moved her down the hallway and to a seclusion
room, which was unnecessary. CA reported at the facility they
work towards very strategic interventions with youth and this
physical intervention happened quicker than normal.
4

VIDEO FOOTAGE REVIEWED:
Video footage for 10/7/23 was reviewed. It should be noted there
was no audio. Youth A is looking at a mirror hung on the window
of the staff office. Supervisor 1 walks behind her, looks in a room
on the opposite side of the staff office and then walks back and
stands behind Youth A. Staff 1 is seen on the lefthand side of
Youth A and they are exchanging words. Youth A then walks
away from the mirror and steps towards Staff 1. Youth A was
standing face to face with Staff 1 when Supervisor 1 stepped in
between them. Youth A shoves her body against Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor 1 takes his hand, puts it on her upper chest and
shoves her backwards against the wall/glass windows of the staff
office. Supervisor 1 remains in between Staff 1 and Youth A.
Supervisor 1 points down the hallway. Staff 1 walks to the room
directly past the staff office and unlocks the door. Supervisor 1 is
standing side-by-side next to Youth A in front of the staff office.
Supervisor 1 has his hand underneath Youth A’s arm, and they
take a couple steps towards the room Staff 1 unlocked. Youth A
then yanks her arm away from Supervisor 1’s grasp and steps
backwards. Supervisor 1 turns to face her, and they exchange
words. Staff 1 is seen taking the mattress out of the room and
throwing it on the hallway floor. Supervisor 1 is standing in front of
Youth A while her back is up against the windows/wall of the staff
office. Staff 1 walks over, stands next to them and points down to
the open room past the staff office. Staff 1 walks away and stands
in front of the open room while Supervisor 1 stands facing Youth
A. Supervisor 1 points towards the room Staff 1 is standing by
twice. Supervisor 1 looks at Staff 1 and exchanges words. Then
Staff 1 comes towards them. Youth A is in the corner outside of
the staff office. Staff 1 grabs one of Youth A’s forearms while
Supervisor 1 grabs her other forearm and they both pull her out of
the corner by her arms. They position themselves on either side of
her and push her into the open room with one of their hands
positioned around her forearm and the other on her shoulder.
Youth A is seen resisting while they push her towards the room.
Once she is in the room, they are out of camera view. Staff 1 and
Supervisor 1 are in the room with Youth A for approximately 24
seconds before they both exit the room (Staff 1 first, followed by
Supervisor 1) and shut the door. Staff 1 is seen with Youth A’s
glasses in his hand, and he puts them in the staff office.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Facility incident report dated 10/7/23 authored by Staff 1.
The incident report states Youth A started to become
5

disrespectful by cussing and yelling at Staff 1. Youth A was
then instructed to have a seat to refocus, but Youth A said,
“fuck you fat motherfucker” and threw grooming products
down the hall where Youth B was sitting. Supervisor 1 was
called. When Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 were talking, Youth
A made verbal threats, walked up to Staff 1, and made
physical contact with Staff 1. Youth A was placed in a non-
violent two-person transport escorted to room. Youth A was
held by the wrist and shoulder area. Incident report notes
Youth A was seen by Nurse 1 on 10/7/23 and was given
Tylenol as Youth A reported her “back hurt a little”.
• MiSACWIS Incident Report #164690210 dated 10/7/23
authored by Supervisor 1. As Staff 1 was explaining the
situation to Supervisor 1, Youth A became even more
angry. Youth A began aggressively approaching Staff 1
while yelling and cussing at him. Supervisor 1 attempted to
step between the resident and staff. Clear and concise
directions were given to Youth A to stop and take her
position in the back hall. Youth A continued making
physical contact with Supervisor 1. Youth A continued to
escalate and make verbal threats. Due to the unsafe
behavior of Youth A, her inability to comply with simple
instruction, and in the effort to keep a safe working
environment for staff, Youth A was directed to enter a
seclusion room. Youth A refused several times. Supervisor
1 and Staff 1 utilized CPI team transport to escort Youth A
into a seclusion room.
• Oakland County Children’s Village Prohibited Practices
Policy (rev. 10/1/22) states pulling or pushing a youth on
any part of their body for the purpose of punishment is
prohibited.
• Youth A’s written statement was reviewed, and it was
mostly consistent with Youth A’s interview. However, in the
written statement, Youth A reported Supervisor 1 pushed
her inside the room and onto her knees, which caused her
chin to hit the bed.
• Staff 1 has one disciplinary record in his employee file
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 1 has completed CPI
training on at least annually since 2002, with the most
recent time being on 10/5/23.
6

• Supervisor 1 has no disciplinary records in his employee
file. Supervisor 1 has completed CPI training at least
annually since 2014, with the most recent time being
9/15/22.
• CPI Sample Workbook states individuals are obligated to
reduce use and prevent the misuse and abuse of physical
interventions. CPI Manual outlining approved safety
interventions does not show any physical management
technique that would involve pushing a youth or pulling a
youth’s arms to escort them to another area.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and video footage reviewed, this
violation is established. The video footage shows Supervisor 1
pushed Youth A backwards. The video footage also shows Staff 1
and Supervisor 1 grabbing Youth A’s wrists/lower arms and pulling
her to the seclusion room, prior to implementing the approved CPI
two-person transport.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2022C0217061 dated 10/19/22; CAP approved 11/17/22
SIR 2023C00000020 dated 12/27/22; CAP approved 1/17/23
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Supervisor 1 grabbed youth's arms, put them behind her back and
lifted them to her neck.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
10/17/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
Supervisor 1 put her in a kneeling position in front of the bed and
had her leaning over the bed with her chin touching the bed.
Youth A noted the bed was all metal because they had already
removed the mattress from the bed prior to putting her in the
room. Supervisor 1 grabbed both of her arms behind her back and
yanked them upwards (like chicken wings) and held them in place
against her back. Youth A reported she wasn’t fighting against
them or resisting, so there was no reason to restrain her arms or
hold her against the bed. Youth A reported Staff 1 and Supervisor
1 didn’t say anything to de-escalate her, and she thought it was
weird neither of them asked her what was wrong or tried to talk
7

her through her behaviors to help her calm down. Youth A
reported she saw Nurse 1 on 10/7/23 because her back was
hurting and she thought there might be a bruise, but there were no
visible injuries. Youth A reported on 10/9/23 she spoke to Clinician
and saw Nurse 2. Youth A reported there was a bruise on her arm
on 10/9/23.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
10/17/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 1
reported when they got Youth A into the room, they had her kneel
on the floor in front of the bed and lean her over the bed.
Supervisor 1 reported he put both of Youth A’s arms behind her
back and was holding her arms with his left hand to secure her
arms against her lower back. Supervisor 1 reported while he was
holding Youth A, Staff 1 took Youth A’s glasses so she couldn’t
use them to self-harm. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 left the room
first and then Supervisor 1 let go and followed him out of the
room. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A wasn’t fighting back or
resisting, which is why he was able to hold both of her arms with
just one hand. Supervisor 1 reported holding Youth A’s arms
behind her back was not a restraint they learned in CPI, but it was
the only way he could control both arms by himself.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/17/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported he had
Youth A’s right arm outstretched in front of her on the bed and
was holding it down. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 1 removed Youth
A’s glasses so she couldn’t self-harm. Staff 1 reported he took the
glasses, left the room and Supervisor 1 left the room right after
him. Staff 1 reported he could not remember if Supervisor 1 ever
held Youth A’s arms behind her back in the room.
Nurse 2 was interviewed via phone on 11/2/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Nurse 2 reported she saw Youth A on
10/9/23 and assessed her for injuries. Nurse 2 reported Youth A
had a nickel-sized bruise on her right forearm, which she took a
picture of. Nurse 2 reported Youth A did not complain of any other
injuries.
VIDEO FOOTAGE REVIEWED:
Video footage for 10/7/23 was reviewed. The camera angle does
not show inside the seclusion room, so there was no video
footage of the alleged restraint.
8

DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• MiSACWIS Incident Report #164690210 dated 10/7/23
authored by Supervisor 1. The incident report does not
document anything that occurred while Youth A was in
the seclusion room with Staff 1 and Supervisor 1.
• Facility incident report dated 10/7/23 authored by Staff
1. The incident report does not document anything that
occurred while Youth A was in the seclusion room with
Staff 1 and Supervisor 1.
• Oakland County Children’s Village Emergency Restraint
Policy (rev. 7/18/22) states emergency restraint shall be
performed in the manner described by Rule 159(5).
• Youth A’s Behavioral/Calming Plan dated 9/27/23
outlines Youth A’s triggers, warning signs/behavior/body
changes when triggered, and helpful coping
mechanisms for when Youth A is triggered. One of
Youth A’s triggers is the loss of her grandparents, which
occurred last time she was at Children’s Village.
Personalized interventions for Youth A are also outlined,
which include reading, listening to music, writing in a
reflection journal, group activities, and eating. Youth A’s
plan states “being alone” is not helpful when she is
upset.
• Youth A’s written statement was reviewed, and it was
mostly consistent with Youth A’s interview. However, in
the written statement, Youth A reported Supervisor 1
pushed her inside the room and onto her knees, which
caused her chin to hit the bed.
• Photograph dated 10/9/23 of Youth A’s right forearm
showing a small nickel to quarter sized bruise.
• Staff 1 has one disciplinary record in his employee file
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 1 has completed
CPI training on at least annually since 2002, with the
most recent time being on 10/5/23.
• Supervisor 1 has no disciplinary records in his
employee file. Supervisor 1 has completed CPI training
at least annually since 2014, with the most recent time
being 9/15/22.
9

• CPI Sample Workbook states individuals are obligated
to reduce use and prevent the misuse and abuse of
physical interventions. CPI Manual outlining approved
safety interventions does not show any physical
restraints that include holding a youth’s arms behind
their back.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentation reviewed, this
violation is established. Supervisor 1 admitted he held Youth A’s
arms behind her back, which is not an approved CPI trained
restraint.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2022C0214026 dated 7/29/22; CAP approved 8/16/22
SIR 2023C0000024 dated 12/15/22; CAP approved 1/30/23
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160 Emergency restraint
Section The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for a
Description youth will be limited to:
(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others
from an unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that
places the youth or others at serious threat of violence or
injury if no immediate intervention occurs.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Supervisor 1 restrained Youth A outside of the parameters
outlined in licensing rules.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
10/17/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
Supervisor 1 put her in a kneeling position in front of the bed and
had her leaning over the bed with her chin touching the bed.
Supervisor 1 grabbed both of her arms behind her back and
yanked them upwards (like chicken wings) and held them in place
against her back. Youth A reported she wasn’t fighting against
them or resisting, so there was no reason to restrain her arms or
hold her against the bed.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
10/17/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 1
reported when they got Youth A into the room, they had her kneel
on the floor in front of the bed and lean her over the bed.
Supervisor 1 reported he put both of Youth A’s arms behind her
back and was holding her arms with his left hand to secure her
arms against her lower back. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A
wasn’t fighting back or resisting, which is why he was able to hold
both of her arms with just one hand. Supervisor 1 reported their
typical protocol when youth go into a room is the youth are
10

supposed to kneel in front of the bed and put their hands
outstretched in front of them on the bed without staff touching
them. Supervisor 1 could not provide a reason for why he did not
follow the typical protocol in this situation. When asked what
verbal de-escalation was used, Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1
attempted those efforts before he arrived. Supervisor 1 reported
once he arrived, he just kept giving Youth A the same instructions
about going into the room or sitting down in the hallway to cool
down, but Youth A wouldn’t listen. Supervisor 1 reported there
were three assaults earlier in the week by different youth towards
staff, and he wasn’t going to take the chance of it getting to that
point.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/17/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported Youth A
knelt in front of the bed on her own and wasn’t fighting or resisting.
Staff 1 reported he could not remember if Supervisor 1 ever held
Youth A’s arms behind her back in the room. Staff 1 reported he
felt he used all his verbal interventions and training to de-escalate
the situation, but he disengaged his verbal communication once
Supervisor 1 arrived.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Oakland County Children’s Village Emergency Restraint
Policy (rev. 7/18/22) states the use of emergency
restraint as a lifesaving response for youth will be
limited to:
o An emergency response to protect youth or
others from threat of violence or injury if no
immediate intervention occurs.
o When all other interventions in the agency’s crisis
plan and youth’s individual safety and calming
plan have been utilized but fail to protect the
youth or others from violence or injury.
• Youth A’s Behavioral/Calming Plan dated 9/27/23
outlines Youth A’s triggers, warning signs/behavior/body
changes when triggered, and helpful coping
mechanisms for when Youth A is triggered, and
personalized interventions to be used with Youth A.
• Supervisor 1 has no disciplinary records in his
employee file. Supervisor 1 has completed CPI training
at least annually since 2014, with the most recent time
being 9/15/22. Supervisor 1 signed an acknowledgment
11

on 8/31/23 stating he had received and reviewed the
facility’s behavior/calming plans policy.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentation reviewed, this
violation is established. Supervisor 1 admitted he held Youth A’s
arms behind her back to restrain her even though Youth A was not
fighting back or being aggressive. Supervisor 1 failed to utilize
Youth A’s behavioral calming plan strategies to help de-escalate
Youth A prior to completing an unwarranted restraint.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162 Seclusion within secure and nonsecure
Section facilities; seclusion plan; prohibitions; reduction and
Description elimination.
(4) Staff must only use seclusion as a temporary response to
prevent life-threatening injury or serious bodily harm when other
interventions are ineffective.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 used seclusion outside the parameters of
the facility’s approved variance.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Youth A was interviewed face to face on 10/17/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 1 told Youth A to
go to a seclusion room, but she said “You never asked what was
going on or tried to talk to me. You’re just telling me to get in a
room”. Youth A reported she didn’t want to go to the room
because last time she was at the facility, she found out a family
member had passed away when she was in that room, so it was a
trigger for her. Youth A reported Supervisor 1 said “get your ass in
the room” and “I’m done with this shit”. Youth A reported when
Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 were approaching her, she stated “if you
put your hands on me, it’s going to be a problem”, but that was the
only thing she said she thought they might have taken as a threat.
Youth A reported Staff 1 came to talk to her after the incident and
explained they put her in a seclusion room because of her
behavior and they thought she was being aggressive.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face on 10/17/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported prior to going
into a seclusion room, Youth A was yelling and cussing at him and
Supervisor 1, but she never threatened them. Staff 1 reported
Youth A did not listen to Staff 1 or Supervisor 1’s instructions to
calm down and sit down. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 1 told him to
prepare a seclusion room, so he did.
12

Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face on 10/17/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 1 reported Youth
A was yelling and cussing at Staff 1 and Supervisor 1. Supervisor
1 reported Youth A was making threats towards Staff 1, but
Supervisor 1 reported he couldn’t remember what any of the
threats were. Supervisor 1 reported he could only remember
Youth A calling Staff 1 derogatory names. Supervisor 1 reported
he told Youth A to have a seat in the hallway and relax, but she
refused. Supervisor 1 reported he told Youth A “we are going to
help you, if you don’t go into the room on your own”. When Youth
A didn’t move, Supervisor 1 reported he said “[Staff 1] we need to
help the young lady to her room”. Supervisor 1 could not provide
any examples of de-escalation skills he used prior to putting Youth
A in a seclusion room. Supervisor 1 reported he had dealt with
three assaults by other youth towards other staff in the five days
prior and wasn’t going to take the chance of it getting to that point.
VIDEO FOOTAGE REVIEWED:
Video footage for 10/7/23 was reviewed. It should be noted there
was no audio. Youth A is looking at a mirror hung on the window
of the staff office. Youth A then walks away from the mirror and
steps towards Staff 1. Youth A was standing face to face with Staff
1 when Supervisor 1 stepped in between them. Youth A shoves
her body against Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 1 takes his hand,
puts it on her upper chest and shoves her backwards against the
wall/glass windows of the staff office. Supervisor 1 points down
the hallway. Staff 1 walks to the room directly past the staff office
and unlocks the door. Supervisor 1 is standing side-by-side next
to Youth A in front of the staff office. Supervisor 1 has his hand
underneath Youth A’s arm, and they take a couple steps towards
the room Staff 1 unlocked. Youth A then yanks her arm away from
Supervisor 1’s grasp and steps backwards. Supervisor 1 turns to
